node.title: IOM3
node.content: IOM hopes to make it easier for its field staff to share data through HDX and to increase the interoperability of this data by using the Humanitarian Exchange Language (HXL).

node.title: IOM2
node.content: IOM hopes to make it easier for its field staff to share data through HDX and to increase the interoperability of this data by using the Humanitarian Exchange Language (HXL).

node.title: Red Cross
node.content: “By tagging the data columns in the csv with HXL (Humanitarian Exchange Language) tags, … data structures trigger quick data visualizations via the HDX dashboard. ” (How can we be locally data-driven? , IFRC)

node.title: IOM
node.content: “IOM hopes to make it easier for its field staff to share data through HDX and to increase the interoperability of this data by using the Humanitarian Exchange Language (HXL).” ( IOM and OCHA: Partners in Displacement Data, IOM)
